name: Loews Ventana Canyon Resort

reviews.title: Ver Romantic
reviews.text: Stayed ther last year, very nice ,clean and comfortable rooms.

Just got back from a week long vacation in Tucson. We have been fortunate enough to have stayed at many 4 and 5 star properties as my boyfriend is a corporate travel agent and we get some great perks. I have never written a review of a hotel before this one and what prompted me was the lobby bar situation at the Loews Ventana Canyon Resort. Let me start with our check-in. We had requested an early check-in but understandably, it sometimes cannot be accommodated as was the case this time. We did have to keep checking each half hour to see if the room was ready. We also were a little grumpy from our very early morning flight so it seemed worse than it was. There were, in fact, quite a few people waiting for their "early check-in rooms". Anyway, our room was great. Clean, bright, view of the city, very close to the elevator and on the 4th floor (so nice view). The marble around the sink in our bathroom was cracked as mentioned earlier, and the bathtub was huge!!! I mean huge!!! The staff at this hotel was very cordial and friendly. The Concierge was the absolute best. Very helpful. Now to the Lobby bar. I think being non-smokers living in a state that has banned smoking from all public places (even bars) has spoiled us. The lobby is attached to the lobby lounge/bar area. A very nice looking comfortable area with a big fireplace in the center. The problem for us was that they allowed smoking in there and at night the entire lobby wreaked of cigar and cigarette smoke. In the early morning you sould still smell the stale smoke lingering. We never sat in there. In fact, we actually went to other resorts to have a cocktail before or after dinner. It was really a shame. They do have 2 pools, but the second pool is kind of hidden behind the spa. It's not as appealing because it's surrounded by a huge iron fence but we were told it is very quiet. There are more good things about this hotel than bad, but I'm not sure I would stay here again unless they enclose the lobby bar. It bothered me that much!
reviews.title: All in all a great vacation

reviews.text: Having graduated UA back in '98, a friend and I decided to "upgrade" instead of staying at a normal priced hotel. It was totally worth it. Everyone is very friendly and professional. Services like "turn-down" and free-water for hiking is greatly appreciated. We got a great deal on their direct website ($208), and were upgraded to a nicer room (nicer means "view") just for joining the Lowes hotel program online before arriving (you get other perks with that, too). The rooms were fantastic--- very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful and featured a large jacuzzi tub. Pool-area is beautiful and the pool itself is immaculate. We didn't eat there because having been "locals" for four years, we had our favorite restaurants to attend. I'd recommend leaving the resort for food- you'll gasp at how much they charge for guacamole at the pool, and it ain't fresh! Bring snacks with you and enjoy a wonderful Tucson retreat.
reviews.title: Excellent upgrade, worth it.
Nice hotel, way Overpriced
reviews.text: Check In:

reviews.title: Friendly hotel
reviews.text: Check-in was very fast and efficent. They located our reservation right away and got us to our room in under 10 min. The bellman who showed us to our room was really nice and gave alot of good advice and information.

reviews.title: What happened to the service?
reviews.text: Stayed at the Ventanna Canyon Saturday-Tuesday - during this time 1) luggage not brought up to our room until we called down and "reminded" them 30 minutes later 2) bed not made one day even though the room had been "cleaned" and when I called down at 4:00 PM to tell them they asked if I wanted it made (DUH)

reviews.title: Lost its luster
reviews.text: 3) there was no silverware with roomservice one breakfast, 4) we got the last 2 of 3 towels at the pool and finally somebody complained so more towels were brought, 5) on Sunday morning (11:00 AM) there were absolutely NO papers anyplace in the hotel, 6) the last night we stayed there there was no top sheet on the bed. Add those irritants to the $9.00 per day parking - and most nights the parking near our unit was totally full so we had to drive around the back of the hotel to find a spot - being delivered iced tea instead of diet coke at the pool, then being rushed to order what turned out to be mediocre food at the Flying V, all convince me that for the price we paid there are better places to stay - even though the room we had was very comfortable and the city view very nice! We paid for service but didn't get any!

reviews.title: Breath Taking Views
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from two weeks in Arizona spending time in three different hotels. While in Tucson, we split our time at this "resort" and the new Marriott. It appears that this property, which used to be a five star, is living off its past. Now don't get me wrong....this is still a nice spot in a beautiful location. However, it is showing its age. Plus, the spa and golf course are nothing special. Our "suite" was dated and noisy. For the price that we paid, we thought we expected more.

reviews.title: Always A Treat
reviews.text: The service is great with the regular staff; the front desk acted as if they worked at the Ritz in Paris.....lose the attitude.

reviews.title: Very Expensive - everything is extra
reviews.text: All in all, we will not return here. Maybe La Paloma is better in the foothills. The Marriott, while having superior suites, is not a great location and not quite finished.

This was my second stay at Loews, the first being 15 years ago... Great location, and the room was really nice... What was really surprising though this time, and others mentioned it, was how they nickel and dime you to death... Plenty of parking spaces, but you get charged an extra fee for parking, even though you're paying several hundred a day for a room... Significant charges for internet access, and you have to order from the restaurant just to get a cup of coffee... (I opted for the five minute drive to Starbucks every morning...) I never experienced this type of routine extra charge for every little thing at a luxury hotel before.
reviews.title: Very nice, but smoky, and they nickel and dime you...
a room with a view??????
reviews.text: The only other negative was the strong cigarette smoke smell in the massive lobby area that could also be smelled in the hallways adjacent to the lobby... Take away the strong tobacco smoke smell in the lobby, and the petty extra charges for the little things, and I could very well become addicted to this place... Even so, I'll probably return to Loews in the future, unless I like the Marriott Star Pass better after I try that facility...

reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!
reviews.text: When I booked the Loews Ventana Canyon Resort almost 6 months ago I was hoping for something special for my 10 year anniversary with my husband. I had requested a room with a view of a "grass or desert landscape view" since my husband loved the desert. I had booked this under an AARP rate and was surprised when our room (room #3269) ended up being approx. 5 to 8 minutes of walking distance from the lobby. There was no straight route of getting there as the elevators did not go from the lobby anywhere near our 3rd floor room. We had to get off and walk a long long way. After walking that distance with our heavy luggage (it was about 108 degrees that day) we found our room to be in a very dark corridor, so dark it was difficult to unlock the door. I was still optimistic that the room itself would make up for the walk. I was very disappointed to find when I opened the door to the patio that my long anticipated view was of desert scrub and we couldn't see anything at all beyond it. The room did not even have a coffee maker. Yes, it did have a small tv in the bathroom but a coffee maker would have been more appreciated since tv screen was so small you couldn't have viewed it from the tub anyway. The room was clean and I have no complaints on the staff of the hotel. They were very friendly to both of us. I just wish our visit would have been more of what I had hoped it to be. The grounds were so beautiful, I just regret not being able to enjoy their lovliness from our room instead of from the window of our car as we drove away.

My husband and I were st Loews Ventana Canyon Resort for four days. We found nothing at all to complain about and much to cheer. Staff - from the front desk to the bell attendant to waiters - were unfailingly efficient, polite, friendly...remembered our names and our favorite NBA team days later. The Flying V gave high quality food and service in a friendly, relaxed atmosphere with unsurpassed views. Poolside fare was tasty and reasonably priced. We enjoyed a tennis match one morning during the "organized tennis"...playing with a regular and a fellow tourist. We enjoyed hiking on the resort trails as well as a brief attempt to hike the more strenuous trail into the mountains behind the resort. (We are young senior citizens.) Quiet nights, beautiful views, courteous and friendly staff...we felt we got our money's worth! Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Beautiful Ventana Canyon Resort
no way back
reviews.text: If you're going to Tucson, you definitely want to be staying in Ventana Canyon and you want to be at Loews. The rest of Tucson looks like El Centro. Ventana Canyon is the country club/yupee area. Very nice. As for Loews, we confirmed what a couple of reviewers mentioned and found a new twist also.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Loews
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for 2 nights for a family visit in Tucson. We got a great rate via Priceline, less than half of any other rate I could find. This was a lovely hotel. There were 4 of us in a room (2 adults and 2 teens), and there was plenty of room for 2 beds and a rollaway. The room also had a balcony with a vie of the mountains (and the parking lot depending on the angle you looked out).
The resort grounds are lovely. You can stroll through the paths behind the pool, where there is varied vegetation and a waterfalls.
reviews.title: Still a Great place to stay

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was excellent, although they were a little slow to bring the cream/milk for the coffee and juices, but everything else was quite nice. They even charged the half price kid's rate for our teens which we did not expect.
reviews.title: Beautiful, High Desert Views, natural Setting

reviews.text: The only thing negative I could say is that the wait service at the pool was awful. You can only eat food at the pool that is served, but to get the attention of a waitress was not easy. Even after we placed our order it took almost an hour for the food to arrive. Maybe the service is better in the high season when they are better staffed, but there were few people at the pool and it still took forever.
reviews.title: Huge Disappointment! This Is NOT A Luxury Resort!

reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay, and given the priceline rate, made it all the more pleasant.
reviews.title: Loews Ventana is fabulous!

description: Welcome to Loews Ventana Canyon, where every guest can take advantage of the breathtaking views and resort activities. Relax in the spacious luxury rooms and private balcony, or combine work with pleasure in the comfortable office space. Enjoy the rugged natural landscapes while playing golf on the two championship golf courses which traverse the canyon.
